intro: Urgineopsis barbata, commonly known as the hairy urge, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare and not widely cultivated.
